title: Flipped Learning-Based Song Lesson Instructional Technology Integration Design for Language Expression Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate theoretical background (basic linguistics, music theory) and practical experience (digital tool usage, basic vocal techniques, elementary writing skills) required
context.additional_context: Targeting professional adult learners, this course strengthens self-directed language expression skills using digital devices. It applies a context-based language learning approach through song creation as a medium, focusing on improving learners' text comprehension, vocabulary expansion, and expressive versatility.

learning_goals: Learners can use EdTech tools in a flipped learning environment to record ≥2 weekly self-practice sessions for pronunciation/intonation and improve expressive skills and fluency based on voice analysis reports.

Learners can achieve ≥80% accuracy in breath control and articulation via a smart voice monitoring system and produce natural language expressions using advanced vocabulary and complex sentence structures.

Learners can collaborate with ≤3 teammates to record/produce a 3-minute original song, present it in ≤5 minutes (video or live), and score ≥4/5 in ≥4 of 5 peer rubric items (pronunciation, fluency, intonation, creativity, collaboration).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
